DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Additional Tumor Tissue Preservation Date/Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date and time that additional tumor tissue specimens were preserved by fixation or freezing.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Added; extra; further._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further.:A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.:The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Display format: MM/DD/YYYY HR:MN; Use NCIt based Rep Class
